intro: Monochaetum tenellum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is native to Australia and is typically found in wetland or swampy habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic organisms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
